channel.title: Monster hit?
channel.description: Hey, some of my monsters won't hit. They just stand there and just die from a player. How do I make them hit?

item.title: Monster hit?
item.dc:creator: @heroisgay heroisgay
item.description:
@heroisgay wrote:

[quote=“dowon8, post:3, topic:250978”][quote author=moparwha link=topic=331153.msg2585721#msg2585721 date=1229485619]
npchandler.java make they’re hitdiff something like

						} else if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == 3727 && plr.ProtMelee == false) {
							npcs[NPCID].animNumber = 64;
hitDiff = 0 + misc.random(10);
						} else if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == 3727 && plr.ProtMelee == true) {
							npcs[NPCID].animNumber = 64;
hitDiff = 0;

[/quote]

After it says npcType = #, does the # mean the npc id? And where is the number that the monster hits max or something?[/quote]

the “3727” is the NPCID, hitdiff = , mis.random(##) will make it hit a random number up to that, just a number will make it hit that only, and other things. He just ripped the codes from his npchandler so dont try to count on it to help you.

Read full topic

item.title: Monster hit?
item.dc:creator: @dowon8 dowon8
item.description:
@dowon8 wrote:

[quote=“moparwha, post:2, topic:250978”]npchandler.java make they’re hitdiff something like

} else if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == 3727 && plr.ProtMelee == false) { npcs[NPCID].animNumber = 64; hitDiff = 0 + misc.random(10); } else if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == 3727 && plr.ProtMelee == true) { npcs[NPCID].animNumber = 64; hitDiff = 0; [/quote]

After it says npcType = #, does the # mean the npc id? And where is the number that the monster hits max or something?
